packagegui.name: sudo
packagegui.title: System/Sudo

field.description:
User permission definitions for allowing the use of sudo by shell users to run commands as other users, such as root.

More information on the full command options may be found in the sudoers manual.

By default the command is "ALL" meaning the user can run any commands. Leaving the commands field blank assumes "ALL".

A comma-separated list of commands can be supplied to limit the user to individual binaries. Full paths to binaries must be used.

rowhelperfield.description: Commands the user may run. Comma-separated list, full paths required. Default: ALL

field.description:
Include additional custom configuration files from /usr/local/etc/sudoers.d.

Including custom configuration files allows options to be set which are not supported by the GUI, but these files can be a potential security risk and they are not backed up.
